meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent2: The horn blawed to signal the start of the race.
meanings.sent3: The blawed alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent4: The wind blawed through the trees like a fierce symphony.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks blawed in the night sky, lighting up the darkness.

meanings.sent1: He blawed about his accomplishments to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: She blawed her opinions without considering others' feelings.
meanings.sent3: The parrot blawed in a comical attempt to mimic human speech.
meanings.sent4: His words blawed like a trumpet, demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The politician blawed promises of change, hoping to win votes.

meanings.sent1: The strong wind blawed the leaves off the trees.
meanings.sent2: She blawed on the dandelion to scatter its seeds.
meanings.sent3: The child blawed bubbles with a straw in the milk.
meanings.sent4: The locomotive blawed steam as it chugged along the tracks.
meanings.sent5: The fan blawed cool air on a hot summer day.
